skill.name: secrets-management
skill.description: Implement secure secrets management for CI/CD pipelines using Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, or native platform solutions. Use when handling sensitive credentials, rotating secrets, or securing CI/CD environments.
skill.summary: Implement secure secrets management for CI/CD pipelines using Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, or native ...

security_audit.summary: The skill content is instructional and contains no executable code or network calls. No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were found.

content.value_statement: CI/CD pipelines often leak secrets through configuration files and logs. This skill provides safe patterns and examples for managing and rotating secrets across common platforms.
actual_capabilities: Explains Vault dev server setup and KV v2 usage.
Shows GitHub Actions and GitLab CI examples for fetching secrets.
Documents AWS Secrets Manager create and retrieve commands.
Provides Kubernetes External Secrets Operator manifest example.
Includes guidance for secret rotation and scanning workflows.
limitations: No live integrations or API calls are performed.
Does not create or modify real secrets in your environment.
Does not provide detailed IAM policy design for each cloud.

use_cases.title: Harden pipeline secrets
use_cases.description: Adopt safe secret handling patterns in CI/CD jobs.

use_cases.title: Standardize secret rotation
use_cases.description: Define rotation steps and audit-friendly practices.

prompt_templates.title: Start with GitHub secrets
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal GitHub Actions example that reads a repository secret and uses it safely in a deployment step.

prompt_templates.title: Vault in GitLab CI
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a GitLab CI job that authenticates to Vault and reads two secret fields for deployment.

prompt_templates.title: AWS Secrets Manager flow
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide steps to create and retrieve a secret from AWS Secrets Manager and export it to GitHub Actions.

prompt_templates.title: Kubernetes external secrets
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a SecretStore and ExternalSecret manifest that maps a database username and password from Vault.

output_examples.input: Summarize steps to use AWS Secrets Manager in GitHub Actions.
output: Configure AWS credentials using the GitHub Actions credential action
Mask the secret and export it to the job environment
Use the environment variable in deployment steps

anti_patterns: Reusing the same secret across environments

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides platform-agnostic guidance and examples that fit those assistants.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It is documentation and examples only. It does not run commands or access your systems.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides examples for GitHub Actions and GitLab CI that you can adapt.

faq.question: Does it access or store my secrets?
faq.answer: No. It does not read files or environment variables.

faq.question: What if a secret still appears in logs?
faq.answer: Enable masking, review echo statements, and use short-lived tokens.

faq.question: How does this compare to a secret scanner?
faq.answer: Secret scanners detect leaks. This skill focuses on preventing leaks in CI/CD design.
